fields.description:
I set private ACL for an upload and went to details for the object after upload and it was public.
Further, changing ACL on object doesn't work either. (Canned ACL worked, but "manually define sharing" did not.

Seems to work with AWS S3.
fields.summary: ACL set for file upload doesn't default to private

comments.body: [~jloza], I'd like to discuss something shown in the screenshot. We talk about "secure by default" in most cases. The permissions default to "public" for upload. When I click "private", then they default to public anyway as in "allusers: read", so I wonder if we should really be defaulting to private and/or when private is clicked, have the default not be "allusers: read"? I would actually like to see it default to "private" and "use-canned-ACL" of "private".

[~dkavanagh], that's a great point. The default should definitely be private.

What's about that line of code where a header is silently set to public-read? What's a verdict on that?

[~rusvika], I was initially not considering that the permissions were set to match the bucket we upload to. That's why I closed this.

In another branch, I removed the default "public-read" thing we talked about.
[~dkavanagh], ok, please don't forget to merge the other branch since this ticket is not tracking this change anymore. Thanks!

[~dkavanagh], [~jloza], coming back to the question of default permissions. Why are object permissions match the bucket permissions by default? That's not AWS behavior as far as I know and it's not a secure setting.

IDK why we designed this to inherit sharing from the bucket, and I can't find any email threads on this. I suspect it was a misunderstanding (S3 is confusing). I'll assign this to myself to update the wireframe and then it can get reassigned to a dev for implementation.

1) updated sharing panel to change private radio button to "Custom" also please note that the implemented text when the public radio button is selected does not match the wireframe and needs to be updated. https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Object+Details
2) updated https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Upload+File to remove inheritance. Sharing panel should default to custom/private acl by default, so we should be good

[~dkavanagh]: We'll need to change the logic in how we check when the sharing panel should select the "Public" radio button.  Currently, the "Public" radio button is selected if *any* of the ACLs have an AllUsers:READ ACL.  We should modify that check to show the public option if the AllUsers:WRITE option isn't also selected (i.e. "Public" = public read only).
yes, I realize code needs to change. Thanks.
[~dkavanagh]: Hold off on working on this for now since we may revamp the sharing panel per a forthcoming update from [~jloza]

[~dkavanagh], hold off on making any changes to the sharing panel. After talking functionality with [~kgill], we simplified the overall design of the sharing panel and it should alleviate this pain and make things simpler for users. I'm opening another ticket for a re-do of the sharing panel. If there's anything outside of the sharing panel that needs to be done for this ticket, that's OK, but there may not be. I think we should hold off on this one and revisit after the updated sharing panel is implemented.
file upload should just link to sharing panel.

more than linking the sharing panel, which we already do, setting the initial state is the question here. Currently, it's defaulting to the bucket ACL. If we need to not pass bucket ACL into the sharing panel and default to private instead, that's the change required here.
yep, should default to owner: full control for all new buckets and objects, please
ok. I'll do that for uploads. New buckets already get that.
[~kgill], looked good, so since Jenkins tests passed I went ahead and merged this one so you could get working on revamped sharing panel. Thanks!

the sharing panel has been re-worked, but it defaults to "current user: FULL_CONTROL" in the upload page. When I looked at the detail page for that object, it also showed the same. I could then add "AllUsers:READ" and that was saved.
